item.title: Large antisemitic graffiti, 9th September
item.description:
There is a huge antisemitic graffiti on the wall at the junction of Silbury Street and Chart St, next to the large hotel building site.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Silbury Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders bans parking dangerously obstructing view of main road, 9th September
item.description:
Builders working on property at 65 petts wood road have for the last four months parked dangerously obstructing the view of the main road ( which is a bus route) so as you cannot get your car safely onto the road . There have been multiple near miss accidents, The builders were asked to be considerate with parking but they have not . You now also have to stand out onto the main road so as the bus driver can see there are passengers to stop and pick up . They are also damaging the pavements as they are also parking there also .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage by developer, 9th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Luscombe Way, Vauxhall, London

item.title: Deep Pothole, 9th September
item.description:
There is a deep pothole in the road just before the junction to Plumstead Common Rd. It's barely visible when driving, especially in the dark and can cause severe damage to cars if hit in an unlucky way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warwick Terrace, Plumstead, London

item.title: Herbert Road the dumping ground, 9th September
item.description:
Herbert Road is a disgrace - a beautiful Victorian street is a dumping ground. Dangerous amounts of rubbish, overflowing smelly bins, household rubbish on streets blocking pathways. When with Greenwich council deal with the cause of the issue rather than just clean up (or not in this case) after them. The main issue I believe is the amount of HMO’s where transient people staying in HMOs don’t care about the community they live in. If you can’t deal with the people dumping the rubbish and incorrectly filling bins, leaving them to overflow and block paths them penalise the landlords of the properties! Make Greenwich clean again please and clean my street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paget Terrace, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
